content:
IClientMessageFormatter Interface

Definition

Defines methods that are used to control the conversion of messages into objects and objects into messages for client applications.

In this Article

public interface IClientMessageFormatter

Remarks

Implement the IClientMessageFormatter interface to create a custom client formatter that serializes objects into messages and deserializes messages into objects for a particular operation.

Attach custom Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) client formatters to the Formatter property to handle this conversion explicitly.

Methods

DeserializeReply(Message,Object[])

Converts a message into a return value and out parameters that are passed back to the calling operation.

public object DeserializeReply (System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message message, object[] parameters);
message
Message

The inbound message.

parameters
Object[]

Any out values.

Returns
Object

The return value of the operation.

Remarks

Called after a reply message is received. Implement to convert the reply message into a return value (and any out parameters) that is returned to the calling application.

SerializeRequest(MessageVersion,Object[])

Converts an Object array into an outbound Message.

public System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message SerializeRequest (System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion messageVersion, object[] parameters);
messageVersion
MessageVersion

The version of the SOAP message to use.

parameters
Object[]

The parameters passed to the WCF client operation.

Returns
Message

The SOAP message sent to the service operation.

Remarks

Called after an operation is invoked on the client but prior to serializing the outbound message. Implement to convert the parameter objects into the outbound message.
